word:
My husband frequently said that when he passed by a beautiful maple tree, he wanted to take off his hat in respect; but that when he saw a large house, he wanted to pass by as quickly as possible. Not the fine houses, but the beauties of nature, appeal to the soul.--Ms 50, 1902, p. 10. ("On Various Phases of Medical-Missionary Work," typed April 17, 1902.) 


                                   -178-
